question_text: What is the difference between an array declared as static, and one that is not?
student_answer: A static array will store the new values that one assigned them to each of its elements. Meaning if one calls a function twice it will use the last values that were returned the first time. If one does not declare it static then the new values will not be stored and will be reset to their original value.
model_answer: The arrays declared as static live throughout the life of the program . One can initialize them only once

question_text: What is the difference between an array declared as static, and one that is not?
student_answer: A static local array exists for the duration of the program and one can initialize its elements to 0 if one did not explicitly initialize it.
